text: Richard Frank "Dick" Gamble (November 16, 1928 in Moncton, New Brunswick - March 22, 2018 in Pittsford, New York) was a Canadian professional ice hockey left winger. He played a combined 9 seasons in the National Hockey League (NHL). He played 6 seasons with the Montreal Canadiens, 1 season with the Chicago Black Hawks and 2 seasons with the Toronto Maple Leafs. Gamble won a Stanley Cup with the Canadiens in 1953. Gamble also played in the American Hockey League with the Rochester Americans. During his time with the Americans, he won 3 Calder Cups and became a player-coach for the Americans in 1968â€“69. title: Dick Gamble
